cs.DC, cs.CR, cs.DS, cs.NI, cs.SY. 

This paper discusses a new model for achieving PoS consensus in a trustless system using a DAG-based approach. The paper focuses on distributed systems and consensus protocols, which are typically covered in the Distributed, Parallel, and Cluster Computing (cs.DC) sub-category. The paper also discusses security and Byzantine fault tolerance, which are relevant to the Cryptography and Security (cs.CR) sub-category. The use of DAGs and the proposed consensus protocol are also relevant to the Data Structures and Algorithms (cs.DS) sub-category. The paper also discusses the use of stake-based systems, which are relevant to the Networking and Internet Architecture (cs.NI) sub-category. Finally, the paper proposes a new model for staking in asynchronous DAG-based distributed systems, which is relevant to the Systems and Control (cs.SY) sub-category.
